text: we can use typescript if we want right? Are you encouraging that?
Interesting, is that a sigh about Typescript? Sure we are encouraging it, but by no means do we want to force/require it
I couldn't find the right sigh, it's a "nice, I know typescript is great but I don't really know it so now I have to and/or get to learn a new thing"
Got it. Please ignore TS for now then :+1:
I'll at least look into some basics. It doesn't feel like it's that much more work + the benefit is pretty obvious

also, pushing my "global build process" agenda, it would be cool if I could use typescript for regular HS modules—I imagine that more than half of my time will be spent building regular modules/themes (especially in the short term)

> It doesn’t feel like it’s that much more work
I’ll admit that Typescript can be a little insidious. In some ways, it is just a little more effort. But sometimes you run into a “WTF, how do I make TS happy with this?” case that can be really annoying and time consuming.

If you are good at ignoring editor red squiggles (and or throwing in an `any` type and moving on) then it might be no biggie. But if you are a person that needs/wants to always do things the “right way” or has a hard time ignoring those red squiggles, I’d suggest some hesitance before jumping into Typescript

>  could use typescript for regular HS modules
Definitely do-able if you already have or are willing to have a build step on your side (we probably could use some examples of that though)
maybe I'll start using it for personal projects first and see how that goes. Deadlines feel like they'll lead to a lot of `any`
I do have a builds step normally but I was hoping to use the same build step for "projects" and for "themes"—which sounds like a road you are not going down at the moment
Yeah, got it. We don’t yet have themes ready for this project build process… but are heading that direction
